member.summary: Converts object to AWnd. Object can contain null, AWnd, Control, or System.Windows.Window (must be in element 0 of object[]). Avoids loading Forms and WPF dlls when not used.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Activate_(Au.AWnd.Internal_.ActivateFlags)
member.summary: Activates this window (brings to the foreground). The same as , but has some options. Returns false if does not activate because of flag IgnoreIfNoActivateStyleEtc.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Activate
member.summary: Activates this window. Also makes it visible and not minimized. The active window is in the foreground and receives keyboard and mouse input.
member.remarks: Activating a window usually also uncloaks it, for example switches to its virtual desktop on Windows 10. Fails (throws exception) if cannot activate this window, except: - If this is a control. Then activates its top-level parent window. - If this is . Then just deactivates the currently active window. - When the target application instead activates another window of the same thread.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ActivateLL
member.summary: Low-level version of . Just calls , API SetForegroundWindow and makes sure that it actually worked, but does not check whether it activated exactly this window. No exceptions, does not unhide, does not restore minimized, does not check is it a top-level window or control, etc. Returns false if fails.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Focus
member.summary: Sets the keyboard input focus to this control. Also activetes its top-level parent window (see ).
member.remarks: The control can belong to any process/thread. With controls of this thread you can use the more lightweight function . Works not with all windows. For example, does not work with Windows Store apps. Then use . Can instead focus a child control. For example, if this is a ComboBox, it will focus its child Edit control. Then does not throw exception. This can be control or top-level window. Top-level windows also can have focus.
member.exception: - Invalid handle. - Disabled. - Failed to set focus. - Failed to activate parent window. Fails to set focus when the target process is admin or uiAccess and this process isn't. See [](xref:uac).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Focused
member.summary: Gets the control or window that has the keyboard input focus.
member.remarks: The control/window can belong to any process/thread. With controls/windows of this thread you can use the more lightweight function . Calls API GetGUIThreadInfo.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsFocused
member.summary: Returns true if this is the control or window that has the keyboard input focus.
member.remarks: This control/window can belong to any process/thread. With controls/windows of this thread you can use the more lightweight function . Calls .

member.name: T:Au.AWnd.ThisThread
member.summary: Functions that can be used only with windows/controls of this thread.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ThisThread.Focus(Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Calls API SetFocus. It sets the keyboard input focus to the specified control or window, which must be of this thread. Returns false if fails. Supports .
member.remarks: Fails if the control/window belongs to another thread or is invalid or disabled. Can instead focus a child control. For example, if ComboBox, will focus its child Edit control. Then returns true.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ThisThread.Focused

member.remarks: Calls API GetFocus.

member.remarks: Calls API GetFocus and .

member.remarks: Calls API GetFocus.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ThisThread.Active
member.summary: Gets the active window of this thread. Calls API GetActiveWindow.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MoveLL(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Au.Types.Native.SWP)
member.summary: Moves and resizes.
member.remarks:
See also . It is better to use in automation scripts, with windows of any process/thread. It throws exceptions, supports optional/reverse/fractional/workarea coordinates, restores if min/max, does not support SWP flags. This function is low-level, it just calls API SetWindowPos with flags NOZORDER|NOOWNERZORDER|NOACTIVATE|swpFlagsToAdd. It is better to use in programming, with windows of current thread. Supports .
For top-level windows use screen coordinates. For controls - direct parent client coordinates.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MoveLL(Au.Types.RECT,Au.Types.Native.SWP)
member.summary: Moves and resizes. Same as .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MoveLL(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves.
member.remarks:
See also . It is better to use in automation scripts, with windows of any process/thread. It throws exceptions, supports optional/reverse/fractional/workarea coordinates, restores if min/max. This function is low-level, it just calls API SetWindowPos with flags NOSIZE|NOZORDER|NOOWNERZORDER|NOACTIVATE. It is better to use in programming, with windows of current thread. Supports .
For top-level windows use screen coordinates. For controls - direct parent client coordinates.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ResizeLL(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resizes.
member.remarks: See also . It is better to use in automation scripts, with windows of any process/thread. It throws exceptions, supports optional/reverse/fractional/workarea coordinates, restores if min/max. This function is low-level, it just calls API SetWindowPos with flags NOMOVE|NOZORDER|NOOWNERZORDER|NOACTIVATE. It is better to use in programming, with windows of current thread. Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Move(Au.Types.Coord,Au.Types.Coord,Au.Types.Coord,Au.Types.Coord,System.Boolean,Au.AScreen)
member.summary: Moves and/or resizes.
member.param: Left. If default(Coord), does not move in X axis.
Top. If default(Coord), does not move in Y axis.
Width. If default(Coord), does not change width.
Height. If default(Coord), does not change height.
x y width height are relative to the work area. Not used when this is a child window.
x y width height are relative to this screen or its work area. Default - primary. Not used when this is a child window.
member.remarks: Also restores the visible top-level window if it is minimized or maximized. For top-level windows use screen coordinates. For controls - direct parent client area coordinates. With windows of current thread usually it's better to use .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Move(Au.Types.Coord,Au.Types.Coord,System.Boolean,Au.AScreen)
member.summary: Moves.
member.param: Left. If default(Coord), does not move in X axis.
Top. If default(Coord), does not move in Y axis.
x y are relative to the work area. Not used when this is a child window.
x y are relative to this screen or its work area. Default - primary. Not used when this is a child window.
member.remarks: Also restores the visible top-level window if it is minimized or maximized. For top-level windows use screen coordinates. For controls - direct parent client coordinates. With windows of current thread usually it's better to use .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Resize(Au.Types.Coord,Au.Types.Coord,System.Boolean,Au.AScreen)
member.summary: Resizes.
member.param: Width. If default(Coord), does not change width.
Height. If default(Coord), does not change height.
For etc use width/height of the work area. Not used when this is a child window.
For Coord.Fraction etc use width/height of this screen. Default - primary. Not used when this is a child window.
member.remarks: Also restores the visible top-level window if it is minimized or maximized. With windows of current thread usually it's better to use .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MoveInScreen(Au.Types.Coord,Au.Types.Coord,Au.AScreen,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves this window to coordinates x y in specified screen, and ensures that entire window is in screen.
member.param: X coordinate in the specified screen. If default(Coord) - screen center. You also can use etc.
Y coordinate in the specified screen. If default(Coord) - screen center. You also can use etc.
Move to this screen (see ). If default, uses screen of this window.
Use the work area, not whole screen. Default true.
If part of window is not in screen, move and/or resize it so that entire window would be in screen. Default true.
member.remarks: If the window is maximized, minimized or hidden, it will have the new position and size when restored, not immediately, except when moving maximized to another screen.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.EnsureInScreen(Au.AScreen,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves this window if need, to ensure that entire window is in screen.
member.param: Move to this screen (see ). If default, uses screen of this window.
Use the work area, not whole screen. Default true.
member.remarks: If the window is maximized, minimized or hidden, it will have the new position and size when restored, not immediately.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MoveToScreenCenter(Au.AScreen)
member.summary: Moves this window to the center of the screen.
member.param: Move to this screen (see ). If default, uses screen of this window.
member.remarks: Calls ShowNotMinMax(true) and MoveInScreen(default, default, screen, true).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Screen
member.summary: Gets of the screen that contains this window (the biggest part of it) or is nearest to it. If this window handle is default(AWnd) or invalid, gets the primary screen. Calls .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ZorderAbove(Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Places this window before window w in the Z order. Also can make this window topmost or non-topmost, depending on where w is in the Z order. This window and w can be both top-level windows or both controls of same parent. May not work with top-level windows when it would move an inactive window above the active window. If w is default(AWnd), calls .
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ZorderBelow(Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Places this window after window w in the Z order. Also can make this window topmost or non-topmost, depending on where w is in the Z order. This window and w can be both top-level windows or both controls of same parent. May not work with top-level windows when it would move an inactive window above the active window. If w is default(AWnd), calls .
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ZorderTop
member.summary: Places this window or control at the top of the Z order. If the window was topmost, it will be at the top of topmost windows, else at the top of non-topmost windows (after topmost windows). Does not activate. In most cases does not work with top-level inactive windows, although returns true; instead use .
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ZorderBottom
member.summary: Places this window or control at the bottom of the Z order. If the window was topmost, makes it and its owner window non-topmost.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ZorderTopmost
member.summary: Makes this window topmost (always on top of non-topmost windows in the Z order). Does not activate. If this window has an owner window, the owner does not become topmost. This cannot be a control.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ZorderNoTopmost(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes this window non-topmost. If this window has an owner window, makes the owner window non-topmost too. This cannot be a control.
member.param: Also place this window below the active nontopmost window in the Z order, unless the active window is its owner.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsTopmost
member.summary: Returns true if this is a topmost (always-on-top) window.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ZorderIsAbove(Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Returns true if this window is above window w in the Z order.

member.summary: Calls API GetWindowThreadProcessId. Returns thread id and also gets process id. Returns 0 if fails. Supports . It is native thread id, not Thread.ManagedThreadId.

member.remarks: It is not the same as .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsOfThisThread
member.summary: Returns true if this window belongs to the current thread, false if to another thread. Also returns false when fails (probably window closed or 0 handle). Supports . Calls API GetWindowThreadProcessId.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsOfThisProcess
member.summary: Returns true if this window belongs to the current process, false if to another process. Also returns false when fails (probably window closed or 0 handle). Supports . Calls API GetWindowThreadProcessId.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsUnicode
member.summary: Returns true if the window is a Unicode window, false if ANSI. Also returns false when fails (probably window closed or 0 handle). Supports . Calls API IsWindowUnicode.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Is32Bit
member.summary: Returns true if the window is of a 32-bit process, false if of a 64-bit process. Also returns false if fails. Supports .

remarks.note: If you know that the window belongs to current process, instead use IntPtr.Size==4. This function is much slower.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsHung

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsHungGhost
member.summary: Returns true if the window is a ghost window that the system creates over a hung (not responding) window to allow the user to minimally interact with it.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsConsole

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsUacAccessDenied
member.summary: Returns true if [](xref:uac) would not allow to automate the window. It happens when current process has lower UAC integrity level and is not uiAccess, unless UAC is turned off.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ClassName
member.summary: Gets window class name. Returns null if fails, eg if the window is closed. Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ClassNameIs(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the class name of this window matches cn. Else returns false. Also returns false when fails (probably window closed or 0 handle). Supports .
member.param: Class name. Case-insensitive wildcard. See . Cannot be null.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ClassNameIs(System.String[])
member.summary: If the class name of this window matches one of strings in classNames, returns 1-based index of the string. Else returns 0. Also returns 0 if fails to get class name (probably window closed or 0 handle). Supports .
member.param: Class names. Case-insensitive wildcard. See . The array and strings cannot be null.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Name
member.summary: Gets name. Returns "" if no name. Returns null if fails, eg if the window is closed. Supports .
member.remarks: It is not the .NET Control.Name property. To get it you can use . Top-level window name usually its title bar text. Control name usually is its text that does not change, for example button or static (label) control text. Unlike , this function usually does not get variable text, for example Edit control editable text, ComboBox control selected item text, status bar text. Calls (false, true).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.NameTL_
member.summary: Gets window name using API InternalGetWindowText. The same as GetText(false, false). This should be a top-level window, because does not process ampersands.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ControlText
member.summary: Gets control text. Returns "" if no text. Returns null if fails, eg if the window is closed. Supports .
member.remarks: Unlike , this function prefers variable text, for example Edit control editable text, ComboBox control selected item text, status bar text. For controls that cannot have such text (eg button, static), it usually gets the same text as Name. For example button and static (label) controls. Much slower than Name. Fails if the window is hung. Calls (true, false).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetText(System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets window/control name or control text. Returns "" if it is empty. Returns null if fails, eg if the window is closed. Supports . This is a low-level function. You can instead use and .
member.param: How to get text: - false - use API InternalGetWindowText. This is used by . - true - use API WM_GETTEXT. It is slow and prefers editable text. This is used by . Fails if the window is hung. - null - try InternalGetWindowText. If it gets "" and this is a control, then try WM_GETTEXT.
Remove the invisible '&' characters that are used to underline keyboard shortcuts with the Alt key. Removes only if this is a control (has style WS.CHILD). Calls .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd._GetTextFast(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets text. Returns "" if it is empty. Returns null if fails, eg if the control is destroyed or its thread is hung. Supports . Calls API InternalGetWindowText. If it fails, and getControlTextIfEmpty==true, and this is a control, calls _GetTextSlow, which uses WM_GETTEXT.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd._GetTextSlow
member.summary: Gets text. Returns "" if it is empty. Returns null if fails, eg if the control is destroyed or its thread is hung. Supports . Uses WM_GETTEXT.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Sets window/control name or control text.
member.param: Text. Can be null, it is the same as "".
member.remarks: Uses API WM_SETTEXT. Top-level window name usually its title bar text. For variable-text controls (edit, combo box, status bar, ...) this usually is the text that would get. For other controls (button, static, ...) and top-level windows this usually is the text that would get.
member.exception: Failed, for example the window is closed.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.NameAcc
member.summary: Gets of the accessible object (role WINDOW) of this window or control. Returns "" if the object has no name or failed to get it. Returns null if invalid window handle.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.NameWinForms
member.summary: Gets Control.Name property of a .NET Windows Forms control. Returns null if it is not a Windows Forms control or if fails.

remarks.note: Use this with controls of other processes. Don't use with your controls, when you have a Control object.
Slow when getting names of multiple controls in a window. Instead create an instance and call its method for each control.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ProgramName
member.summary: Gets filename of process executable file, like "notepad.exe". Return null if fails.
member.remarks: Calls and . This function is much slower than getting window name or class name. Don't use code like if(w.ProgramName=="A" || w.ProgramName=="B"). Instead use var s=w.ProgramName; if(s=="A" || s=="B").

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ProgramNameIs(System.String[])
member.summary: If the program name of this window matches one of strings in programNames, returns 1-based index of the string. Else returns 0. Also returns 0 if fails to get program name (probably window closed or 0 handle). Supports .
member.param: Program names, like "notepad.exe". Case-insensitive wildcard. See . The array and strings cannot be null.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ProgramPath
member.summary: Gets full path of process executable file. Return null if fails.
member.remarks: Calls and . This function is much slower than getting window name or class name. Don't use code like if(w.ProgramPath=="A" || w.ProgramPath=="B"). Instead use var s=w.ProgramPath; if(s=="A" || s=="B").

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ProgramDescription
member.summary: Gets description of process executable file. Return null if fails.
member.remarks: Calls and . This function is slow. Much slower than .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Close(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the window. Returns true if successfuly closed or if it was already closed (the handle is 0 or invalid) or if noWait==true.
member.param: If true, does not wait until the window is closed. If false, waits about 1 s (depends on window type etc) until the window is destroyed or disabled.

If false (default), uses API message WM_CLOSE. If true, uses API message WM_SYSCOMMAND SC_CLOSE, like when the user clicks the X button in the title bar. Most windows can be closed with any of these messages, but some respond properly only to one of them. For example, some applications on WM_CLOSE don't exit, although the main window is closed. Some applications don't respond to WM_SYSCOMMAND if it is posted soon after opening the window, for example Internet Explorer.
member.remarks: The window may refuse to be closed. For example, it may be hung, or hide itself instead, or display a "Save?" message box, or is a dialog without X button, or just need more time to close it. If the window is of this thread, just calls or (if noWait==true) and returns true.

example.code: //close all Notepad windows AWnd.FindAll("* Notepad", "Notepad").ForEach(t => t.Close());

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ChildFinder.Result

member.param: List of controls, for example returned by .
Direct or indirect parent window. Used only for flag DirectChild.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ChildFinder._FindInList(Au.AWnd,Au.AWnd._WndList,System.Action{Au.AWnd})
member.summary: Returns index of matching element or -1. Returns -1 if using getAll.
member.param: Parent window. Can be default(AWnd) if inList is true and no DirectChild flag and not using winforms name.
List of AWnd. Does not dispose it.
If not null, calls it for all matching and returns -1.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ChildFinder.IsMatch(Au.AWnd,Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Returns true if control c properties match the specified properties.
member.param: A control. Can be 0/invalid, then returns false.
Direct or indirect parent window. If used, returns false if it isn't parent (also depends on flag DirectChild).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Child(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WCFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds a child control and returns its handle as AWnd.
member.returns: Returns default(AWnd) if not found. See also: , .
member.param:
Control name. String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression). null means 'can be any'. "" means 'no name'.
By default to get control names this function uses . Can start with these prefix strings: - "***text " - use . Slower and less reliable because can get editable text. If a character can be underlined with Alt, insert '&' before it. - "***accName " - use . Slower. - "***wfName " - use .NET Forms control name (see ). Slower and can fail because of [](xref:uac). - "***id " like "***id 15" - use control id (). See also .
Control class name. String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression). null means 'can be any'. Cannot be "".
Callback function. Called for each matching control. It can evaluate more properties of the control and return true when they match. Example: also: t => t.IsEnabled
0-based index of matching control. For example, if 1, the function skips the first matching control and returns the second.
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).
- name starts with "***", but the prefix is invalid. - cn is "". To match any, use null. - Invalid wildcard expression ("**options " or regular expression).
member.remarks: To create code for this function, use dialog "Find window or control". It is form Au.Tools.FormAWnd in Au.Tools.dll.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.HasChild(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WCFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns true if this window contains the specified control. Calls .
Using this function many times with same parameters is inefficient. Instead create new and call or . See example.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.HasChild(Au.AWnd.ChildFinder)
member.summary: Returns true if this window contains the specified control. Calls .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.HasAcc(Au.AAcc.Finder)
member.summary: Returns true if this window contains the specified accessible object. Calls .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ChildById(System.Int32,Au.Types.WCFlags)
member.summary: Finds a child control by its id and returns its handle as AWnd.
member.returns: Returns default(AWnd) if not found. See also: , .
member.param: Control id.
This function supports flags DirectChild and HiddenToo. If both are set, it is much faster because uses API GetDlgItem. Else uses API EnumChildWindows, like .
member.remarks:
To create code for this function, use dialog "Find window or control". It is form Au.Tools.FormAWnd in Au.Tools.dll.
Not all controls have a useful id. If control id is not unique or is different in each window instance, this function is not useful.
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ChildAll(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WCFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Finds all matching child controls. Returns List containing 0 or more control handles as AWnd. Everything except the return type is the same as with .
member.remarks: In the returned list, hidden controls (when using WCFlags.HiddenToo) are always after visible controls.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ChildFast(System.String,System.String,Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Finds a direct child control and returns its handle as AWnd.
member.returns: Returns default(AWnd) if not found. See also: , . Supports .
member.param: Name. Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported. null means 'can be any'. "" means 'no name'. Must include the invisible '&' characters that are used to underline keyboard shortcuts with the Alt key.
Class name. Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported. null means 'can be any'. Cannot be "".
If used, starts searching from the next control in the Z order.
member.remarks: Calls API FindWindowEx. Faster than , which uses API EnumChildWindows. Can be used only when you know full name and/or class name. Finds hidden controls too.

member.name: T:Au.AWnd.GetWnd
member.summary: Static functions of this class are used to get special windows (used like AWnd w = AWnd.GetWnd.Top;) and all windows. Instances of this class are used to get related windows and controls, like AWnd w2 = w1.Get.FirstChild; (here w1 is an AWnd variable).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Children(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets child controls, including all descendants. Returns array containing 0 or more control handles as AWnd.
member.param: Need only visible controls.
Place all array elements of hidden controls at the end of the array.
Need only direct children, not all descendants.
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).
member.remarks: Calls API EnumChildWindows.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Children(System.Collections.Generic.List{Au.AWnd}@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets child controls, including all descendants.
member.param: Receives window handles as AWnd. If null, this function creates new List, else clears before adding items.
Need only visible controls.
Place all array elements of hidden controls at the end of the array.
Need only direct children, not all descendants.
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).
member.remarks: Use this overload to avoid much garbage when calling frequently with the same List variable. Other overload always allocates new array. This overload in most cases reuses memory allocated for the list variable.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.AllWindows(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets top-level windows. Returns array containing window handles as AWnd.
member.param: Need only visible windows. Note: this function does not check whether windows are cloaked, as it is rather slow. Use if need.
Place hidden windows at the end of the array. If false, the order of array elements matches the Z order. Not used when onlyVisible is true.
member.remarks: Calls API EnumWindows. The array can be bigger than you expect, because there are many invisible windows, tooltips, etc. See also . Does not get message-only windows; use if need. On Windows 8 and later does not get Windows Store app Metro-style windows (on Windows 10 few such windows exist), unless this process has [](xref:uac) integrity level uiAccess or High+uiAccess or its manifest contains disableWindowFiltering; to get such windows you can use . Tip: To get top-level and child windows in single array: var a = AWnd.GetWnd.Root.Get.Children();.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.AllWindows(System.Collections.Generic.List{Au.AWnd}@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets top-level windows.
member.param: Receives window handles as AWnd. If null, this function creates new List, else clears before adding items.
member.remarks: Use this overload to avoid much garbage when calling frequently with the same List variable. Other overload always allocates new array. This overload in most cases reuses memory allocated for the list variable.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.ThreadWindows(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets top-level windows of a thread. Returns array containing 0 or more window handles as AWnd.
member.param: Unmanaged thread id. See , . If 0, throws exception. If other invalid value (ended thread?), returns empty list. Supports .
Need only visible windows.
Place all array elements of hidden windows at the end of the array, even if the hidden windows are before some visible windows in the Z order.
member.remarks: Calls API EnumThreadWindows.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.ThreadWindows(System.Collections.Generic.List{Au.AWnd}@,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets top-level windows of a thread.
member.remarks: This overload can be used to avoid much garbage when caling frequently.

If at that point is a visible child of the sibling, get that child. Default false.

If at that point is a visible child of the sibling, get that child. Default false.

Horizontal offset from the left of this control. If negative - to the left. Default 5.
If at that point is a visible child of the sibling, get that child. Default false.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Next(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets next sibling window or control in the Z order. Returns default(AWnd) if this is the last or if fails.
member.param: How many next windows to skip.
member.remarks: If this is a top-level window, gets next top-level window, else gets next control of the same direct parent. Calls API GetWindow(GW_HWNDNEXT). Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Previous(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets previous sibling window or control in the Z order. Returns default(AWnd) if this is the first or if fails.
member.param: How many previous windows to skip.
member.remarks: If this is a top-level window, gets previous top-level window, else gets previous control of the same direct parent. Calls API GetWindow(GW_HWNDPREV). Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.FirstSibling
member.summary: Gets the first sibling window or control in the Z order. If this is the first, returns this.
member.remarks: If this is a top-level window, gets the first top-level window, else gets the first control of the same direct parent. Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDFIRST). Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.LastSibling
member.summary: Gets the last sibling window or control in the Z order. If this is the last, returns this, not default(AWnd).
member.remarks: If this is a top-level window, gets the last top-level window, else gets the last control of the same direct parent. Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDLAST). Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.FirstChild
member.summary: Gets the first direct child control in the Z order. Returns default(AWnd) if no children or if fails.
member.remarks: Calls API GetWindow(GW_CHILD). Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.LastChild
member.summary: Gets the last direct child control in the Z order. Returns default(AWnd) if no children or if fails.
member.remarks: Calls API GetWindow. Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Child(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a direct child control by index. Returns default(AWnd) if no children or if index is invalid or if fails.
member.param: 0-based index of the child control in the Z order.
member.remarks: Calls API GetWindow. Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Owner
member.summary: Gets the owner window of this top-level window. Returns default(AWnd) if this window isn't owned or if fails.
member.remarks: A window that has an owner window is always on top of it. Controls don't have an owner window. Supports . This function is the same as , which also allows to change owner.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Window
member.summary: Gets the top-level parent window of this control. If this is a top-level window, returns this. Returns default(AWnd) if fails.
member.remarks: Supports . This function is the same as .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.DirectParent
member.summary: Gets the direct parent window of this control. It can be the top-level window or another control. Returns default(AWnd) if this is a top-level window or if fails.
member.remarks: Supports . Unlike API GetParent, this function never returns the owner window.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.EnabledOwned(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the first (in Z order) enabled window owned by this window.
member.param: Return this window if there are no enabled owned windows. If false, then returns default(AWnd).
member.remarks: Calls API GetWindow(GW_ENABLEDPOPUP). Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.LastActiveOwnedOrThis(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the most recently active window in the chain of windows owned by this window, or this window itself if there are no such windows. Returns default(AWnd) if fails.
member.param: Can return an owner (or owner's owner and so on) of this window too.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.RootOwnerOrThis(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the bottom-most owner window in the chain of owner windows of this window. If this window is not owned, returns this window. Returns default(AWnd) if fails.
member.param: If this is a child window, use its top-level parent window instead.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.OwnersAndThis(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets all owner windows of this window, including this window or its top-level parent. Returns array that starts with this window or its top-level parent (if control).
member.param: Skip invisible windows.
member.remarks: This window can be top-level window or control. If control, its top-level parent window will be the first in the array. This function for example can be used to temporarily hide a tool window and its owners when capturing something from the screen.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Top
member.summary: Gets the very first top-level window in the Z order.
member.remarks: Probably it is a topmost window. Calls API GetTopWindow(default(AWnd)).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Root
member.summary: Calls API GetDesktopWindow. It gets the virtual parent window of all top-level windows.

remarks.note: It is not the desktop window (see ) that displays icons and wallpaper.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Shell
member.summary: Calls API GetShellWindow. It gets a window of the shell process (usually process "explorer", class name "Progman"). Returns default(AWnd) if there is no shell process, for example Explorer process killed/crashed and still not restarted, or if using a custom shell that does not register a shell window.
member.remarks: It can be the window that contains desktop icons (see ) or other window of the same thread.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.Desktop
member.summary: Gets the desktop window that displays desktop icons and wallpaper in its child control .
member.remarks: It is not API GetDesktopWindow () This function is not very reliable. May stop working on a new Windows version or don't work with a custom shell. Returns default(AWnd) if there is no shell process, for example Explorer process killed/crashed and still not restarted, or if using a custom shell that does not register a shell window.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.DesktopControl
member.summary: Gets the control of "SysListView32" class that contains desktop icons and wallpaper. It is a child of .
member.remarks: This function is not very reliable. May stop working on a new Windows version or don't work with a custom shell. Returns default(AWnd) if there is no shell process, for example Explorer process killed/crashed and still not restarted, or if using a custom shell that does not register a shell window.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.IsMainWindow(Au.AWnd,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns true if window w is considered a main window, ie probably is in the Windows taskbar. Returns false if it is invisible, cloaked, owned, toolwindow, menu, etc.
member.param: On Windows 10 include (return true for) windows on all virtual desktops. On Windows 8 include Windows Store apps (only if this process has [](xref:uac) integrity level uiAccess).
Return false if w is minimized.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.MainWindows(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets main windows, ie those that probably are in the Windows taskbar. Returns array containing 0 or more AWnd.
member.param: On Windows 10 include windows on all virtual desktops. On Windows 8 include Windows Store apps (only if this process has [](xref:uac) integrity level uiAccess).
member.remarks: Uses . Does not match the order of buttons in the Windows taskbar.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.GetWnd.NextMain(Au.AWnd,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets next window in the Z order, skipping invisible and other windows that probably are not in the Windows taskbar. Returns default(AWnd) if there are no such windows.
member.param: Start from this window. If default(AWnd), starts from the top of the Z order.
On Windows 10 include windows on all virtual desktops. On Windows 8 include Windows Store apps (only if this process has [](xref:uac) integrity level uiAccess).
Skip minimized windows.
If w is not default(AWnd) and there are no matching windows after it, retry from the top of the Z order. Then can return w.
member.remarks: Uses . This function is quite slow. Does not match the order of buttons in the Windows taskbar.

member.name: T:Au.AWnd.WButton
member.summary: Like , but has only button, check box and radio button functions - Click, Check etc.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.WButton.W
member.summary: Button handle as AWnd.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WButton.op_Implicit(Au.AWnd.WButton)~Au.AWnd
member.summary: Implicit cast AWnd=WButton.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WButton.op_Explicit(Au.AWnd)~Au.AWnd.WButton
member.summary: Explicit cast WButton=(WButton)AWnd.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WButton.Click(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a "click" message to this button control. Does not use the mouse.
member.param: Use . If false (default), posts BM_CLICK message.
member.remarks: Works not with all button controls. Sometimes does not work if the window is inactive. Check boxes and radio buttons also are buttons. This function can click them.

example.code: AWnd.Find("Options").Child("Cancel").AsButton.Click();

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WButton.Check(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks or unchecks this check box. Does not use the mouse. Calls with state 0 or 1.
member.param: Checks if true, unchecks if false.
member.remarks: Works not with all button controls. Sometimes does not work if the window is inactive. If this is a radio button, does not uncheck other radio buttons in its group.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WButton.SetCheckState(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets checkbox state. Does not use the mouse.
member.param: 0 unchecked, 1 checked, 2 indeterminate.
Use . If false (default), posts BM_SETCHECK message and also BN_CLICKED notification to the parent window; if that is not possible, instead uses BM_CLICK message.
member.remarks: Does nothing if the check box already has the specified check state (if can get it). Works not with all button controls. Sometimes does not work if the window is inactive. If this is a radio button, does not uncheck other radio buttons in its group.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WButton.IsChecked(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets check state of this check box or radio button. Calls and returns true if it returns 1.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WButton.GetCheckState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets check state of this check box or radio button. Returns 0 if unchecked, 1 if checked, 2 if indeterminate. Also returns 0 if this is not a button or if failed to get state.
member.param: Use . If false (default) and this button has a standard checkbox style, uses API BM_GETCHECK.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.AsButton
member.summary: Casts this to .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ButtonClick(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a child button by id and sends a "click" message. Does not use the mouse. Calls .
member.param: Control id of the button. This function calls to find the button.
Use . If false (default), posts BM_CLICK message.

example.code: AWnd.Find("Options").ButtonClick(2);

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ButtonClick(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a child button by name and sends a "click" message. Does not use the mouse. Calls .
member.param: Button name. This function calls to find the button.
Button class name to pass to .
Use . If false (default), posts BM_CLICK message.

example.code: AWnd.Find("Options").ButtonClick("Cancel");

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MenuClick(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Posts a "menu item clicked" notification (WM_COMMAND) as if that menu item was clicked. Does not use the mouse.
member.param: Menu item id. Must be in range 1 to 0xffff.
The menu item is in the title bar's context menu, not in the menu bar. Posts WM_SYSCOMMAND instead.
member.remarks: Works only with standard (classic) menus. The drop-down menu window class name must be "#32768". Works with menu items in window menu bar, system menu and some context menus. Does not use the menu itself. Just posts WM_COMMAND or WM_SYSCOMMAND message. Even if a menu item with this id does not exist. This variable is the window that contains the menu bar or system menu. Or the drop-down menu window (class "#32768") that contains the menu item.

member.name: T:Au.AWnd.Finder
member.summary: Contains top-level window properties and can be used to find the window.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Finder.Props
member.summary: Parsed parameter values. All read-only.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.op_Implicit(System.String)~Au.AWnd.Finder
member.summary: Implicit conversion from string that can contain window name, class name, program and/or a contains object. Examples: "name,cn,program", "name", ",cn", ",,program", "name,cn", "name,,program", ",cn,program", "name,,,object".
member.param: One or more comma-separated window properties: name, class, program and/or a contains object. Empty parts are considered null. The same as parameters of . The first 3 parts are name, cn and of. The last part is contains as string; can specify an accessible object, control or image. The first 3 comma-separated parts cannot contain commas. Alternatively, parts can be separated by '\0' characters, like "name\0"+"cn\0"+"program\0"+"object". Then parts can contain commas. Example: "*one, two, three*\0" (name with commas).
member.exception: If specifies a contains object: exceptions of constructor of or or .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Finder.Result
member.summary: The found window.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.Find
member.summary: Finds the specified window, like . Returns true if found. The property will be the window.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.FindInList(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Au.AWnd})

member.param: Array or list of windows, for example returned by .

member.summary: Returns index of matching element or -1. Returns -1 if using getAll.
member.param: List of AWnd. Does not dispose it.
If not null, calls it for all matching and returns -1.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Finder.IsMatch(Au.AWnd,Au.Types.WFCache)
member.summary: Returns true if window w properties match the specified properties.
member.param: A top-level window. If 0 or invalid, returns false.
Can be used to make faster when multiple Finder variables are used with same window. The function gets window name/class/program once, and stores in cache; next time it gets these strings from cache.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Find(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains)
member.summary: Finds a top-level window and returns its handle as AWnd.
member.returns: Returns default(AWnd) if not found. See also: , .
member.param: Window name. Usually it is the title bar text. String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression). null means 'can be any'. "" means 'no name'.
Window class name. String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression). null means 'can be any'. Cannot be "".

Program file name, like "notepad.exe". String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression). null means 'can be any'. Cannot be "". Cannot be path.
Or (process id), (thread id), (owner window). See , , , , .

Callback function. Called for each matching window. It can evaluate more properties of the window and return true when they match. Example: also: t => !t.IsPopupWindow. Called after evaluating all other parameters except contains.

Defines an object that must be in the client area of the window: - Accessible object: or string like "name" or "a 'role' name" or "a 'role'". - Child control: or string like "c 'cn' name" or "c '' name" or "c 'cn'". - Image(s) or color(s): or string "image:..." (uses AWinImage.Find with flag ).
member.remarks:
To create code for this function, use dialog "Find window or control". It is form Au.Tools.FormAWnd in Au.Tools.dll.
If there are multiple matching windows, gets the first in the Z order matching window, preferring visible windows.
On Windows 8 and later finds only desktop windows, not Windows Store app Metro-style windows (on Windows 10 few such windows exist), unless this process has uiAccess or High+uiAccess or has disableWindowFiltering in manifest; to find such windows you can use .
To find message-only windows use instead.
member.exception: - cn is "". To match any, use null. - of is "" or 0 or contains character \ or /. To match any, use null. - Invalid wildcard expression ("**options " or regular expression).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FindAll(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains)
member.summary: Finds all matching windows. Returns array containing 0 or more window handles as AWnd. Parameters etc are the same as .
member.remarks: The list is sorted to match the Z order, however hidden windows (when using ) are always after visible windows.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FindFast(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Finds a top-level window and returns its handle as AWnd.
member.returns: Returns default(AWnd) if not found. See also: , .
member.param: Name. Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported. null means 'can be any'. "" means 'no name'.
Class name. Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported. null means 'can be any'. Cannot be "".
Search only message-only windows.
If used, starts searching from the next window in the Z order.
member.remarks: Calls API FindWindowEx. Faster than , which uses API EnumWindows. Finds hidden windows too. Supports . It is not recommended to use this function in a loop to enumerate windows. It would be unreliable because window positions in the Z order can be changed while enumerating. Also then it would be slower than Find and FindAll.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FindFastCached_(System.Int64@,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calls , sets this and time, but only if !IsAlive or more than 1 s elapsed since that. Returns this.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FindOrRun(System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains,System.Action,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a top-level window (calls ). If found, activates (optionally), else calls callback function and waits for the window. The callback should open the window, for example call . Returns window handle as AWnd. Returns default(AWnd) if not found (if runWaitS is negative; else exception).
member.param: See .
See .
See .
See .
See .
See .
Callback function. See example.
How long to wait for the window after calling the callback function. Seconds. Default 60. See .
Finally the window must be active. Default: true.
member.exception: runWaitS time has expired. Not thrown if runWaitS <= 0.

example.code: AWnd w = AWnd.FindOrRun("* Notepad", run: () => AFile.Run("notepad.exe")); AOutput.Write(w);

member.summary: Compares window name and other properties like does. Returns true if all specified (non-null/default) properties match.
member.param: See .
See .
See .
See .
See .
See .
member.remarks: Creates new and calls . To compare single parameter, use more lightweight code. Examples: if (w.Name.Like("* Notepad")), if (w.ClassNameIs("CabinetWClass")).

member.name: T:Au.AWnd._WndList
member.summary: An enumerable list of AWnd for and . Holds Util.ArrayBuilder_ or IEnumerator or single AWnd or none. Must be disposed if it is Util.ArrayBuilder_ or IEnumerator, else disposing is optional.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FromXY(Au.Types.POINT,Au.Types.WXYFlags)
member.summary: Gets visible top-level window or control from point.
member.param: Coordinates. Tip: To specify coordinates relative to the right, bottom, work area or a non-primary screen, use , like in the example.
member.remarks: Alternatively can be used API WindowFromPoint, ChildWindowFromPointEx or RealChildWindowFromPoint, but all they have various limitations and are not very useful in automation scripts. This function gets non-transparent controls that are behind (in the Z order) transparent controls (group button, tab control etc); supports more control types than RealChildWindowFromPoint. Also does not skip disabled controls. All this is not true with flag Raw. This function is not very fast, probably 0.3 - 1 ms.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.FromMouse(Au.Types.WXYFlags)
member.summary: Gets visible top-level window or control from mouse cursor position. More info: .

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ChildFromXY(Au.Types.Coord,Au.Types.Coord,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets child control from point. Returns default(AWnd) if the point is not in a child control or not in the client area of this window.
member.param: X coordinate in the client area of this window. Can be etc.
Y coordinate in the client area of this window. Can be Coord.Reverse etc.
The coordinates are relative to the pimary screen, not to the client area.
Get direct child, not a child of a child and so on.
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.ChildFromXY(Au.Types.POINT,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: Coordinates in the client area of this window.
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd._SiblingXY(Au.AWnd._SibXY,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get sibling control in space: left, right, above or below. Returns default(AWnd) if there is no sibling.
member.param: Distance from this control (from its edge) in the specified direction. Default 10.

Distance in perpendicular direction, along the specified edge. Default 5. If direction is Left or Right, 0 is the top edge, 1 is 1 pixel down, -1 is 1 pixel up, and so on. If direction is Above or Below, 0 is the left edge, 1 is 1 pixel to the right, -1 is 1 pixel to the left, and so on.
If at that point is a visible child or descendant of the sibling, get that child/descendant. Default false.
member.exception: This variable is invalid (window not found, closed, etc).
member.remarks: This function is used mostly with controls, but supports top-level windows too.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Get
member.summary: Gets related windows and controls. Use like AWnd w2 = w1.Get.Owner; (here w1 is an AWnd variable).

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.SwitchActiveWindow
member.summary: Activates next non-minimized main window, like with Alt+Tab. Returns true if activated, false if there is no such window or failed to activate.
member.remarks: Uses , , . An alternative way - send Alt+Tab keys, but it works not everywhere.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.OwnerWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner window of this top-level window.
member.remarks: A window that has an owner window is always on top of it. Don't call this for controls, they don't have an owner window. The 'get' function returns default(AWnd) if this window isn't owned or is invalid. Supports . The 'set' function can fail, eg if the owner's process has higher [](xref:uac) integrity level or is a Store app.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Window
member.summary: Gets the top-level parent window of this control. If this is a top-level window, returns this. Returns default(AWnd) if this window is invalid.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsChild
member.summary: Returns true if this is a child window (control), false if top-level window.
member.remarks: Supports . Another way is w.HasStyle(WS.CHILD). It is faster but less reliable, because some top-level windows have WS_CHILD style and some child windows don't.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.IsChildOf(Au.AWnd)
member.summary: Returns true if this is a child or descendant of window w.
member.remarks: Calls API IsChild. Supports .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.ParentGWL_
member.summary: Returns (AWnd)GetWindowLong(Native.GWL.HWNDPARENT).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.Active
member.summary: Gets the active (foreground) window. Calls API GetForegroundWindow. Returns default(AWnd) if there is no active window; more info: .

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsActive
member.summary: Returns true if this window is the active (foreground) window.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsActiveOrNoActiveAndThisIsWndRoot_
member.summary: Returns true if this window is the active (foreground) window. If this is , returns true if there is no active window.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.SetTransparency(System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{Au.Types.ColorInt})
member.summary: Sets opacity and/or transparent color.
member.param: Set or remove WS_EX_LAYERED style that is required for transparency. If false, other parameters are not used.
Opacity from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (opaque). Does not change if null. If less than 0 or greater than 255, makes 0 or 255.
Make pixels of this color completely transparent. Does not change if null. The alpha byte is not used.
member.remarks: Uses API SetLayeredWindowAttributes. On Windows 7 works only with top-level windows, on newer OS also with controls.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsFullScreen
member.summary: Returns true if this is a full-screen window and not desktop.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsOfShellThread_
member.summary: Returns true if this belongs to GetShellWindow's thread (usually it is the desktop window).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsOfShellProcess_
member.summary: Returns true if this belongs to GetShellWindow's process (eg a folder window, desktop, taskbar).

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsWindows8MetroStyle
member.summary: Returns true if this window has Metro style, ie is not a classic desktop window. On Windows 8/8.1 most Windows Store app windows and many shell windows have Metro style. On Windows 10 few windows have Metro style. On Windows 7 there are no Metro style windows.

member.name: P:Au.AWnd.IsWindows10StoreApp
member.summary: Returns non-zero if this window is a Windows 10 Store app window: 1 if class name is "ApplicationFrameWindow", 2 if "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow".

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.SavePositionSizeState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets window position, size and state stored in a string that can be used with . Returns null if failed. Supports .
member.param: If now the window is minimized, let RestorePositionSizeState make it minimized. If false, RestorePlacement will restore it to the most recent non-minimized state.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.RestorePositionSizeState(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Restores window position, size and state that is stored in a string created by .
member.param: The string. Can be null/"".
Call . Even when s is null/"".
Call (true) and . Even when s is null/"".

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MinimalSleepIfOtherThread_
member.summary: if(!IsOfThisThread) { Thread.Sleep(15); SendTimeout(1000, 0); }

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.MinimalSleepNoCheckThread_
member.summary: Thread.Sleep(15); SendTimeout(1000, 0);

member.name: M:Au.AWnd._WindowsStoreAppFrameChild(Au.AWnd)
member.summary: On Win10+, if w is "ApplicationFrameWindow", returns the real app window "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow" hosted by w. If w is minimized, cloaked (eg on other desktop) or the app is starting, the "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow" is not its child. Then searches for a top-level window named like w. It is unreliable, but MS does not provide API for this. Info: "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow" windows hosted by "ApplicationFrameWindow" belong to separate processes. All "ApplicationFrameWindow" windows belong to a single process.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.Wait(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,Au.Types.WOwner,Au.Types.WFlags,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},Au.Types.WContains)
member.summary: Waits until window exists, is visible (optionally) and active (optionally). Returns window handle. On timeout returns default(AWnd) if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception. Parameters etc are the same as .
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
The window must be the active window (), and not minimized.
member.remarks: By default ignores invisible and cloaked windows. Use flags if need. If you have a window's AWnd variable, to wait until it is active/visible/etc use instead.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WaitAny(System.Double,System.Boolean,Au.AWnd.Finder[])
member.summary: Waits until any of specified windows exists, is visible (optionally) and active (optionally). Returns 1-based index and window handle. On timeout returns (0, default(AWnd)) if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception.
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
The window must be the active window (), and not minimized.
One or more variables containing window properties. Can be strings, see .
member.remarks: By default ignores invisible and cloaked windows. Use finder flags if need.

example.code: var (i, w) = AWnd.WaitAny(10, true, "* Notepad", new AWnd.Finder("* Word")); AOutput.Write(i, w);

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WaitForCondition(System.Double,System.Func{Au.AWnd,System.Boolean},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Waits for a user-defined state/condition of this window. For example active, visible, enabled, closed, contains control.
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
Callback function (eg lambda). It is called repeatedly, until returns true.

Do not throw exception when the window handle is invalid or the window was closed while waiting. In such case the callback function must return false, like in the examples with . Else exception is thrown (with a small delay) to prevent infinite waiting.
member.returns: Returns true. On timeout returns false if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception.
member.exception: The window handle is invalid or the window was closed while waiting.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WaitForName(System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Waits until this window has the specified name.
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
Window name. Usually it is the title bar text. String format: [](xref:wildcard_expression).
member.returns: Returns true. On timeout returns false if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception.
member.exception: The window handle is invalid or the window was closed while waiting.

member.name: M:Au.AWnd.WaitForClosed(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Waits until this window is closed/destroyed or until its process ends.
member.param: Timeout, seconds. Can be 0 (infinite), >0 (exception) or <0 (no exception). More info: [](xref:wait_timeout).
Wait until the process of this window ends.
member.returns: Returns true. On timeout returns false if secondsTimeout is negative; else exception.
member.exception: Failed to open process handle when waitUntilProcessEnds is true.
member.remarks: If the window is already closed, immediately returns true.
